text: Charles Robert "Splinter" Johnson (June 16, 1920 – August 6, 2002) was an American professional basketball player. He played in the National Basketball League for the Hammond Ciesar All-Americans during the 1940–41 season and averaged 4.0 points per game. == References == Category:1920 births Category:2002 deaths Category:American men's basketball players Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Basketball players from Indiana Category:Centers (basketball) Category:Forwards (basketball) Category:Hammond Ciesar All-Americans players Category:People from Frankfort, Indiana Category:Purdue University alumni
